properties.areaDesc: Marengo, AL; Greene, AL; Hale, AL; Sumter, AL
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:17AM CST by NWS Birmingham AL
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock
and Dam, Demopolis Lock and Dam, and Gainesville Lock and Dam...

.Moderate flood stage continues at river forecast locations along
the Tombigbee River. However, levels at Bevill Lock and Dam are
expected to fall below moderate flood this afternoon, and below
flood stage by Wednesday based on the latest forecast.

Gainesville Lock and Dam is currently cresting this morning, but
will remain in moderate flood stage through at least Wednesday
morning.

Demopolis Lock and Dam still has not reached its crest, and is
expected to rise close to 85 feet by Tuesday morning. The last time
Demopolis rose over 85 feet was on May 27, 1983.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Tombigbee River At Demopolis Lock and Dam.
* until further notice...or until the warning is cancelled.
* At 9:15 AM Monday the stage was 84.9 feet.
* Flood stage is 68 feet.
* Moderate flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will continue rising to near 85.0 feet by
tomorrow morning then slowly begin falling.
* Impact...At 84 feet...Some industrial and residential flooding
begins just upstream from Demopolis Dam at 88 feet. Widespread
flooding in Greene...Marengo...and Sumter counties occurs and some
evacuations may be necessary.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas.  Turn Around...Don't Drown.

Another statement will be issued by Tuesday morning...or sooner if
conditions warrant.
